title: Functional Equations Basics (Injectivity, Cauchy Pitfalls)
content:
Overview

Start with standard moves: plug constants, look for injectivity/surjectivity, swap variables, and search for invariants.

Domain Matters

Solutions over \mathbb{R} often differ from \mathbb{Z} or \mathbb{Q} due to regularity assumptions.

Hard Problem

Find all functions f:\mathbb{Z}\to\mathbb{Z} such that f(x+y)+f(x-y)=2f(x)+2f(y) for all integers x,y.

Solution Sketch

Putting y=0 gives f(0)=0; try polynomial ansatz and use induction to get f(n)=an^2.

# Check a quadratic solution
import random
for a in [1,2,-3]:
    def f(n):
        return a*n*n
    for _ in range(10):
        x,y=[random.randint(-5,5) for __ in range(2)]
        assert f(x+y)+f(x-y)==2*f(x)+2*f(y)
print("checked")
